paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variants, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed at age 32 with neuropathy and cardiac symptoms.
Patient P2 was diagnosed at age 38 with cardiac symptoms.
Patient P3 remains asymptomatic at age 45.

functional_data.summary: Functional assays indicate that the V30M variant leads to misfolding and amyloid deposition.

variants.population_frequency: Rare in general population, specific frequency not provided.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple family studies.
variants.additional_notes: The V30M variant is the most common mutation associated with Familial Transthyretin Amyloidosis.
key_quotes: More than one hundred mutant forms of TTR are known and many of these are associated with pathological familial amyloid diseases.
At least fifteen nephropathic mutants have been discovered, with a single amino acid substitution of V to M at position 30 as the most common mutation.

tables_processed.table_caption: Variants in the TTR gene associated with Familial Transthyretin Amyloidosis

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR gene variants were extracted successfully.
